H0.text: Covalent bonds are what hold together molecules formed by atoms of nonmetals when a compound forms.

H1.text: Phenotype bonds are the bonds that hold together molecules formed by atoms of nonmetals in a compound.

H2.text: Magnetic bonds are the type of bonds that hold together molecules formed when atoms of nonmetals combine to form a compound.

H3.text: Dissonance bonds are the bonds that hold together molecules formed when atoms of nonmetals combine to form compounds.

A4.text: A covalent bond is a chemical bond that involves the sharing of electrons to form electron pairs between atoms.

A5.text: In organic chemistry, covalent bonding is much more common than ionic bonding.
